channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.description:
Report X-2024040348

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was initially noticed on a van after it had been out for delivery. The smell of the liquid was noticeable immediately upon entering the van. The package was then taken to the damage cage. DescribePack: There are three wet spots on the package, about 4"x2" each. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was brought to the damage cage and placed under the hood.

item.title: Report X-2024040269
item.description:
Report X-2024040269

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking during the loading of a trailer and was promptly placed into a lined HazMat tote. DescribePack: Loose caps caused the container to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a lined HazMat tote with orientation labels up to prevent any further leaks and taken to the damage HazMat cage.
